Assigned Commissioner’s and Administrative Law Judge’s Ruling Amending Scope. The category of the proceeding is ratesetting. Evidentiary hearings are not necessary at this time. The scope of this proceeding is amended to include the additional Phase II issues as is set forth. The schedule for Phase II of this proceeding is as set forth. The presiding officer is Administrative Law Judge Camille Watts-Zagha.

RULING SETTING JOINT STATUS CONFERENCE AND ORDERING COMMENTS. A joint status conferences is set in Rulemaking (R.) 17-06-024 and R.21-02-014 on August 16, 2021, at 9 a.m. via the Webex platform. Parties to Rulemaking (R.) 17-06-024 and R.21-02-014 shall serve and file, in both proceedings, comments responsive to the questions set forth above in Sections 1, 3, 4 and 5 of this ruling by September 13, 2021. Parties to R.21-02-014 shall serve and file briefs responsive to the questions set forth above in Section 2 of this ruling by August 27, 2021.

E-MAIL RULING GRANTING PARTY STATUS TO EAST BAY COMMUNITY ENERGY. By March 19, 2021, EBCE shall supply its analysis of EBCE customer arrearages during the COVID-19 period to Benjamin.menzies@cpuc.ca.gov of the Commission’s Energy Division for dissemination via the Commission’s R.21-02-14 webpage Rulemaking 21-02-014 to Address Energy Utility Customer Bill Debt Accumulated During the COVID-19 Pandemic (ca.gov).

Assigned Commissioner’s Scoping Memo and Ruling. The category of the proceeding is ratesetting. Evidentiary hearing is not needed. The scope and the schedule of this proceeding are as set forth. The presiding officer is Administrative Law Judge Camille Watts-Zagha.
